comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: The above 'flickr' pic may have come from here, taken in 1980, around the time of a special VQ-2 EA-3B flight titled; ‘Round the World Road Trip’: www.vpnavy.com/p3/vq2p3_01_03sep2001.jpg VQ-2 P-3 BUNO: XXX025 "...VQ-2 (JQ-25) EP-3B and EA-3B fly in formation near NS Rota, Spain, July 1980. Photo from the Naval Historical Center..." Contributed by Mahlon K. Miller mkwsmiller@cox.net [03SEP2001] VQ-2 'Batmen'. EP-3E Orion 150494 Tail code JQ Modex code 25 EA-3B Skywarrior 146455 Tail code JQ. Modex code 17 just under pipe of refuelling probe. Relevant VQ-2 patch: (there were several for the unit) www.vpnavy.com/logo_01/vq2patch_01_03oct2006. jpg …………………………………………………………………………………………… Two other 'flickr' pics of EA-3B 146455: www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/4564691116/ www.flickr.com/photos/18532986@N07/4698162058/ From my own personal notes gathered on EA-3B’s assigned to both units VQ-1 and VQ-2. Modex 17 from VQ-2 may be EA-3B Bu No 146455. EA-3B Skywarrior 146455 Originally built as Douglas A3D-2Q Skywarrior, From 1962 redesignated EA-3B. Constructor number 12407. Accepted by US Navy April 1960. Assigned to VQ-2 as Modex 7. Tail code JQ. Seen Weisbaden, Germany Feb 1st 1971 as Modex 17. JQ. www.planepictures.net/netshow.php?id=785711 Ref to EA-3B BUNO 146455 R-7 in near mishap 9 Sept 1970: www.portlyautey.com/ECM-2.htm Ex USS John F Kennedy, forward undercarriage U/S - divert Rota, and by pilot skill landed safely. EA-3B 146455 flew from NAS Rota Spain to USS Eisenhower in Pacific 1980 on ‘Round World Road Trip’. Took part in round world flight with EA-3B 146455 during Aug 1980. www.aero-web.org/database/aircraft/getimage.htm?id=309 JQ-17 BUNO 146455, USS Eisenhower 1980 picasaweb.google.com/herndonjohn/EA3B#5131430091203074674 picasaweb.google.com/herndonjohn/EA3B#5131428089748314706 Seen as Modex 17. JQ. Andrews Air Force Base 1980 a3skywarriorforwhidbey.org/EA-3B_VQ-2_JQ17_Andrews_AFB_9a... Seen as Modex 17. JQ. Frankfurt Rhein Main. Germany. 19 Dec 1980. flugzeugbilder.de/show.php?id=911954 Seen on 'Coral Sea' CV-43 off Libya coast 1986 as 17, JQ. www.usscoralsea.net/images/8586a3vq2.jpg EA-3B 146455 was also seen as 17 at Prestwick Scotland Sept 1986. This web page from ‘GO!NAVY’ website by Takafumi Hiroe of Japan records VQ-2 aboard CV-66 USS America between 1984 & 1986: www.gonavy.jp/CVW-ABf.html Carrier Air Wing One (CVW-1 tail code AB) was embarked aboard CV-66 USS AMERICA between March 10, 1986 & Sept 14, 1986, for the Mediterranean Sea, Libya and Gulf of Syrte dispute. This is corroborated by information below. A detachment by VQ-2 with EA-3B (Modex unknown) tail code JQ were also on temporary assignment to CVW-1 from their base at Rota in Spain. This is corroborated by information further below. See “1986 - Last deployment of an A-3 Skywarrior on the Coral Maru.” EA-3B 146455 was retired on 9 Sept 1991 to the then AMARC near Tucson, Arizona as AN2A0129, Information gleaned from ‘The AMARC Experience’ web link: www.amarcexperience.com/AMARCDB.asp?SessionId=534092316&a... 146455 ..AN2A0129...Douglas EA-3B Skywarrior….12407..09-SEP-91 Information on Douglas EA-3B Skywarrior 146455 This A/C spent it's entire flying career in VQ-2 out of Rota, Spain. In August 1980 we flew her along with 146453 around the world to catch up with our ship in the Indian Ocean. We took off from Rota, flew to Azores, Nova Scotia, Wash DC, Ellsworth SD, Alameda, Hawaii, Wake IS, Guam, PI, Diego Garcia, USS Eisenhower (our ship), Djibouti, Athens and finally back to Rota. Whew what a trip. We flew like 26,000 miles to catch up to our ship and return, could be a record for a carrier based A/C. Fond memories of this A/C and that around the world flight. Side #'s in VQ-2: #7 #17 then finally #005 John Herndon vq2sandeman@hotmail.com - 23:07:34 16 August 2010 Another info source provides a little info combined with this web picture of both EA-3B 146453 as 15 and 146455 as 17 taken during the ‘Round the World Road Trip’ in August 1980: www.aero-web.org/database/aircraft/getimage.htm?id=309 The picture of the two EA-3Bs Bu No 146453 Ranger 15 and 146455 Ranger 17, was taken over the Pacific Ocean in 1980 on the way to USS Eisenhower in support of the Iranian Hostage Crisis, on VQ-2's first around the world Det RT-80 (Short for Road Trip 1980). Further information on EA-3B 146455 from this excellent picture and caption: www.usscoralsea.net/images/8586a3vq2.jpg 1986 - Last deployment of an A-3 Skywarrior on the Coral Maru. "Dawn Launch" - 'Ranger 17', EA-3B (146455), from VQ-2 on the starboard bow cat of the Coral Sea (CV-43). Mission: Electronic Warfare, locate and identify hostile Libyan Naval Combatant ships. Use AN/ALR-40 ESM and COMINT systems. Mission was successful with the destruction of a Libyan ship by an A-6 bomber. Note the action: Cat crew departing from bridle hookup, Troubleshooter checking bleed ports at both engines as they are brought up to full power and the button man in the catwalk at the ready. It looks like a 'thumbs up launch'. [From Mark Swisher - A-3 Skywarrior Association] By going to this website: www.amarc.info/ Mouse clicking on 'Inventory by type', scroll down to box 'A-3 Skywarrior', mouse click on it and the most up to date inventory list of A-3 Skywarriors stored in desert conditions at AMARG in Arizona may be viewed. Inventory dated 14 Sept 2010 records eleven A-3 Skywarrior; One of which is; EA-3B. Bu No 146455 Arrival Date…..09-Sep-91 Storage Code..AN2A0129 EA-3B Bu No 146455 Still exists in 2010 ! ! …………………………………………………………………………………………… EP-3E 150494 VQ-2 JQ-25 1974 picture of EP-3E 150494, as Modex 22 of VQ-2: www.aero-pics.co.uk/ew/EP-3E%20150494%20Mildenhall%202402... 1974 picture of EP-3E 150494, Modex 22 of VQ-2: www.planepictures.net/netshow.php?id=756322 1980 picture of EP-3E 150494, as Modex 25 of VQ-2: www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Lockheed-EP-3E-Orion/1... 1984 pictures of EP-3E 150494, Modex 25 of VQ-2: jetphotos.net/viewphoto.php?id=5616845&showexif=1 www.abpic.co.uk/photo/1093605/ www.abpic.co.uk/photo/1191881/ www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Lockheed-EP-3E-Orion/1... 1991 picture of EP-3E 150494, of VQ-2: www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Lockheed-EP-3E-Orion/0... 1991 picture of EP-3E 150494, Modex 25 of VQ-2: www.abpic.co.uk/photo/1233082/ Record of EP-3E 150494 and its ultimate fate: www.p3orion.nl/100314_P3ALR-LM.pdf www.p3orion.nl/p3alr.html EP-3E 150494 (former P-3A) Accepted by US Navy 3 Nov 1962. Now scrapped
